title: Trying to install Thunderbird calendar
content: I'm trying to get the calendar app working in a new Thunderbird installation. Here are my notes on what I tried: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/lightning-calendar-tabs/versions/ Download lightning_calendar_tabs-3.8-tb.xpi (latest version) to C:\Users\ken\Downloads In Thunderbird: Tools --> Add-ons --> Gear icon --> Install add-on from file --> C:\Users\ken\Downloads --> lightning_calendar_tabs-3.8-tb.xpi "about:addons Lightning Calendar Tabs could not be installed because it is not compatible with Thunderbird 144.0.1." Any suggestions?

title: Je ne reçois pas les mails de Brevo
content:
Bonjour,

Je suis professionnelle et j'ai crée une adresse mail avec mon nom de domaine: contact@terraito.fr Je souhaite créer un compte sur Brevo pour mettre en place une newsletter mais quand je créée mon compte sur Brevo je suis censée recevoir un mail pour valider mon adresse mail et finaliser la création de mon compte sur Brevo. Après avoir essayé plusieurs fois je ne reçois pas ces mails. J'ai contacté le service client de Brevo et le problème ne vient pas de chez eux car pour eux les mails sont bien partis. Il n'y a rien également dans les spams.

Merci infiniment pour votre aide, Marie CHEVALIER

title: Reading Pain in Chinese
content:
I get messages sent to my e-mail from groups.io.

In groups.io the messages are in english, I have also seen the same messages received on Outlook and the test is in English from a UKJ source so no need to be in Chinese, but when the e-mails are sent to my Thunderbird client they are in Chinese.

It also affects e-mails from PayPal and eBay as well.

How do I change this?

Kind Regards

James
creator: bscdhvbnjc

title: Draft mails "disappearing" in the Windows task bar
content:
Hey all,

I've got a very weird issues (actually more than one), since switching from Win 10 to Win 11.

This particular issue revolves around writing mails. Whenever I start writing a new mail without actually sending it right away (sometimes this takes half an hour or more, while gathering information, resources, etc.), the draft mail will simply "disappear" as its separate window in the Windows taskbar. What I mean is that in the taskbar there is only the main Thunderbird window being shown, while the draft mail can no longer be accessed. It's still there in the folder "Drafts", thankfully, but I basically have to re-open it through that folder EVERY time I want to make an edit to it ... or minimize any other window that has been called to the foreground since editing the draft manually to bring the actual mail back. This happens whether the draft mail is maximized or windowed. Like ... it just vanishes into the ether for some reason, despite being a separate window like with multiple explorer windows, Firefox windows, Excel documents, etc.

If anyone has any idea what could be causing this, I'd be very thankful!

Best regards, Dominik
creator: dlanger

title: Thunderbird vs office365
content:
Sinds kort loopt de uitgaande mail (info@....nl) via de server van Office365.

Ik heb een nieuwe laptop vanwege Windows 11. Op mijn oude laptop werkt alles nog op Thunderbird.

Nu heb ik op mijn nieuwe laptop geprobeerd mijn emailaccount aan te maken, maar Thunderbird herkent mijn wachtwoord niet meer, omdat Office365 zelfs mijn wachtwoord heeft vervangen in een script. Hierdoor kan ik alleen Outlook gebruiken.

Dit staat mij tegen, omdat ik geen volledige zeggenschap meer heb en ik wil daarom mijn email overzetten naar een andere hosting. Dat is geen probleem, want daar loopt al een account van mij, maar zij zijn bang dat ik dan met lege box begin. Volgens mij staat alles in de profielmap van Thunderbird.

Nu heb ik vanmorgen in C://Gebruikers\Administrator\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\, de map gekopiëerd en op een back-up schijf gezet.

Nu is mijn vraag: heb ik dan werkelijk alle gegevens die ik in verschillende aangemaakte mappen heb staan en die nodig zijn voor de nieuwe laptop?

Ik hoop dat ik de vraag duidelijk heb gesteld. Alvast dank voor de hulp. Renée
creator: info13158

title: Thunderbird is missing my email accounts, email folders, calendar, and contacts
content:
I'm on a Win 10 desktop. Version 140.3.1esr worked okay yesterday but when I started it this morning it is now missing my email accounts, folders, calendar, and contacts. Unfortunately I haven't done a backup in some time. The first image shows what I see.

The 2nd image shows that there are 2 profiles in the Thunderbird folder. The rc2jk0cq.default-release profile was created today & appears to have all of my data; it's the default profile. The v9w93tjh.default profile has an extensions folder and 3 files.

How can I recover from this?

Thanks

content:

The “Browse” button does not work. “Play” does not work either, even for the default (system) sound. It looks like a program error.

Od pewnego czasu (którejś aktualizacji) nie działa powiadomienie dźwiękowe o nowej wiadomości. Mam wszystko dobrze ustawione, dźwięk z dysku. Nie działa przycisk "Przeglądaj". Nie działa "Odtwórz" - także dla dźwięku domyślnego (systemowego). Wygląda na błąd programu.

content:
Buenas tardes: Puedo confiar en ese e-mail o es un intento de estafa? La dirección de correo de donde proviene es: ops@techtweekinfotech.com. y dice lo siguiente:

Revise y confirme la información asociada a su cuenta de usuario. Ministerio de Sanidad Verificación pendiente de su información de acceso

Estimado/a usuario/a,

Con el fin de mantener actualizados los registros y garantizar la seguridad de su perfil, se ha iniciado un proceso de verificación de datos básicos de acceso.

Esta acción es necesaria para continuar utilizando los servicios asociados a su cuenta sin interrupciones. 

   Proceso rápido y confidencial.    Revisión de información de usuario y acceso.    Confirmación inmediata al completar el formulario.

Verificar ahora Este mensaje se envía automáticamente desde el sistema de notificaciones. Si ya ha realizado la verificación, puede ignorar este aviso.

Para más información o soporte técnico, visite nuestro portal oficial. © 2025 Servicio Central – Todos los derechos reservados. '
creator: mtbilbao

title: Client Cert frequently times out talking to postfix and dovecot
content:
Up through Thunderbird 142 everything was working great. Starting with 143, I get frequent "client didn't present a certificate" errors, but the next attempt will work (or not). I didn't report it, hoping that 144 would fix it. It didn't, and I've also updated to 144.0.1, still no joy.

I am running Thunderbird on Arch Linux. I am connecting to a postfix/dovecot back end that I control on Ubuntu 24.04. I have made numerous tweaks to various SSL/TLS settings on each side (some of which seemed to lessen the frequency, but not resolve the issue), so I reverted nearly all of the changes.

The issue occurs whether I am in Thunderbird trouble-shooting mode (safe mode) or not. I also cleared the startup cache which made no difference. I am including server output from when I was in trouble-shooting mode, as well as a dump from trouble-shooting mode from Thunderbird.

According to AI (I know, shoot me...), the issue occurs because Thunderbird is insisting on cached TLS connections in TLSv1.3 no matter what settings I have, and dovecot isn't handling it well. I have tried forcing TLSv1.2 only, which is one of the things that made the problem less frequent, but it still didn't go away completely.

I apologize for the formatting in advance, but I don't see any way to upload a file (other than an image?) or create a code block. I'll happily fix this if someone lets me know the correct way to handle this...

Here is the output from dovecot on the server:

Oct 20 10:12:23 imap-login: Info: Login: user=<XXX>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=945421, TLS, session=<Q4IQrJdBsOrAqGQC> Oct 20 10:12:33 imap-login: Info: Login: user=<XXX>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=945436, TLS, session=<i8K1rJdBIsXAqGQC> Oct 20 10:12:35 imap-login: Info: Login: user=<YYY>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=945438, TLS, session=<Oc7VrJdBQovAqGQC> Oct 20 10:14:35 pop3-login: Info: Login: user=<ZZZ>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=945590, TLS, session=<Olzvs5dBcpPAqGQC> Oct 20 10:17:28 pop3-login: Info: Login: user=<ZZZ>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=945770, TLS, session=<0vxBvpdBCNzAqGQC> Oct 20 10:21:20 pop3-login: Info: Login: user=<ZZZ>, method=PLAIN, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, mpid=946000, TLS, session=<dAsezJdBVMXAqGQC> Oct 20 10:25:01 pop3-login: Info: Disconnected: Connection closed (client didn't send a cert): user=<>, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, TLS handshaking: Connection closed, session=<bJVJ2ZdBppPAqGQC> Oct 20 10:28:08 pop3-login: Info: Disconnected: Connection closed (client didn't send a cert): user=<>, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, TLS handshaking: Connection closed, session=<K/dw5JdBqpzAqGQC> Oct 20 10:31:11 pop3-login: Info: Disconnected: Connection closed (client didn't send a cert): user=<>, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, TLS handshaking: Connection closed, session=<Z0lZ75dB8rPAqGQC> Oct 20 10:34:06 pop3-login: Info: Disconnected: Connection closed (client didn't send a cert): user=<>, rip=192.168.100.2, lip=192.168.100.1, TLS handshaking: Connection closed, session=<uZC8+ZdBvpXAqGQC>

And here the much longer output from the trouble-shooting dump. I have sanitized the user names and server names, but nothing else was touched:

title: Not able to receive and send emails
content:
Could anybody help me? Since yesterday morning I have not been able to send or receive emails on Thunderbird.

I have two computers: a laptop and a desktop. On both of them I use Thunderbird as my main email service. On the desktop I also have MS Outlook. I am able to send and receive emails on the desktop on MS Outlook.

Error message on the desktop when I try to send a test email: Sending message failed. The message could not be sent because the Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.rushmore.com failed. The server may be unavailable or refusing SMTP connection. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

Error message on the laptop when I try to send a test email: You are about to override how Thunderbird identifies this site. Legitimate banks, stores, and other public sites will not ask you to do this. Location: mail.rushmore.com:587 [get certificate] This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information. Outdated information The certificate is not currently valid. It may have been stolen or lost, and could be used by someone to impersonate this site. [check] [Permanently store exception] 

    [Confirm Security Exception] [Cancel]

Interestingly, yesterday I was receiving the same error message on the desktop computer, except the number under Location mail.rushmore.com: was different (not 587). I do not remember what this number was.

My current SMTP server settings: Server name: mail.rushmore.com Port: 465 (Default: 465) Connection security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: Normal password User Name: halina@rushmore.com

Please let me know what I can do about this. Thank you!

Halina Hladysz
creator: hhladysz

title: Local Folders
content:
My email storage server has a limited space allocation. Because I keep most emails for future reference/recall, I have been moving important emails to specific folders I have created in LOCAL FOLDERS. The LOCAL FOLDERS resides in a local drive in my main desktop computer.

Lately I switched from POP to IMAP so I will be able to access my emails on my phone, remote desktop at home & on my notebook when I travel.

Because of limited storage space allocation, only the main basic folders (inbox, drafts, sent, junk, trash, etc........) reside on the server & appear on all my connected devices (phone, remote desktop & notebook).

When I am on the main work desktop, everything works flawlessly. I have access to whatever information I need. However, when I am on the other devices, all I see are the basic folders that reside on the server.

Could you suggest a creative way I could take the LOCAL FOLDERS along with me when I am outside the office? I was thinking of mounting the LOCAL FOLDER in the cloud, if that is possible. I will be the only one accessing it (single user) so colliding versions should not be an issue. I was thinking of copying the files on to an external drive then restoring to whichever device I use but the problem with this workaround is syncing back to the main machine.....a lot of extra work & steps.

Any suggestions? Hope to hear from someone soon. Thank you.
creator: esycip8

title: Access calendar programmatically (CLI, local files, etc?)
content:
Is there any way to access my Lightning Calendar events programmatically, either by using some command-line access with thunderbird.exe, or by reading the local files where calendar data is cached? I would like to be able to run scripts locally based off my calendar events.

(I didn't see a better question topic to list this under, although this could also be considered a privacy question since bad actors could use these same cli/file access methods to steal calendar data, I suppose...)
creator: fiffox
